```{r}
eq1 = function (x){
  3*x^2+4
}

#Creating Data frame 
data_range= data.frame(x = c(1,100))

#Now plot
ggplot(data_range, aes(x= x))+
  geom_function(fun=eq1)
```

#### Plotting Derivatives 

#Function ct= t^3

```{r}
ct = function (t) {
t^3
}

# lets create another data range
dat_rg = data.frame(t= c(-5,5))

ggplot(dat_rg, aes (x=t))+
  geom_function(fun=ct)
```

now lets find the derivative 

```{r}
dc_dt = D(expr = expression ( t^3), name= "t")

dc_dt 

#ok now lets store it as a function 

dc_dt_fun = function(t){
  3*t^2
}

ggplot(dat_rg, aes(x=t))+
  geom_function(fun=(ct), color="red")+
  geom_function(fun = dc_dt_fun, color="blue")
```
